results.title: Something wild
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Demme, Kenneth Utt and Primitiva Religiosa
results.brief_description: Uptight tax consultant Charlie (Jeff Daniels) is picked up by eccentric, free-thinker Lulu (Melanie Griffith). Although he’s not entirely certain how he’s going to explain his sudden disappearance to his wife and his boss, he accompanies her on an impulsive journey to the farthest reaches of New Jersey. Lulu introduces Charlie as her husband to her friends and relatives attending a high school reunion. The couple is held hostage by holdup man Ray (Ray Liotta) who happens to be Lulu’s ex. When Ray makes it clear that he wants Lulu back, that’s when the real trouble begins. Cameos by John Sayles, John Waters and Charles Napier. Includes music scores by David Byrne, Laurie Anderson, John Cale.

results.title: Jubal
results.creator_credit: Delmer Daves, William Fadiman and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Paul Wellman, this is a loose reworking of Shakepeare’s Othello into a western setting. Jubal Troop (Glenn Ford), a drifter given a job by his friend, a rancher Shep Horgan (Borgnine), makes an enemy of the range rider (Steiger) when Shep’s restless wife, Mae, is attracted to the newcomer. Driven by jealousy, Pinky sets out to frame Jubal and plants in Shep’s mind the suspicion that Jubal is carrying on with Mae. Wanting to hurt both Shep who she doesn’t love, and Jubal who has spurned her, Mae untruthfully confirms Pinky’s story. Shep goes gunning for Jubalm and the heat of the Wild West is matched by the passions at Horgan’s ranch, as anger turns to treachery…and murder.

results.title: I was a ninety pound weakling
results.creator_credit: Georges Dufaux, Roman Kroitor, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An amusing character study of people who are anxious to keep themselves fit and to also keep other people in good condition. Sports coaches, gymnasium proprietors, exercise machine salesmen, a health book publisher and a yoga instructor are interviewed. They discuss the frequent low standards of physical fitness in Canada and the various ways they recommend for improving physical condition.

results.title: Three Mile Creek (MAC)
results.creator_credit: Alyssa Rothwell and Department of Visual Communication, RMIT
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
This CD ROM is a collection of anecdotal accounts inspired by the experience of growing up in rural Australia. Music, dialogue and soundscape evoke the richness of the environment and create a sense of being there. A contemplative approach is the key to enjoying the stories. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Recommended for use on a Power MacIntosh with a minimum of 15MB free RAM.

results.title: Colour
results.creator_credit: Christa van Santen, Nico Crama and Color Film Center
results.brief_description: Explores the use of colour in art and nature; discusses the concept of colour as the reflection and absorption of white light; explains the significance of hue, value, chroma, and complementary colours; and examines the illusions, emotional impact, and optical effects of colour. Animation: Ronald Raaijmakers. Commentary: Mart Ambry.

results.title: Colour
results.brief_description: A discussion of the nature of color in simple terms. Painting and dying are then shown as a way of preparing surfaces so as to reflect certain colors. Narrated by Joseph McLeod.

results.title: Given a chance
results.brief_description: This is a video which focusses on the life experiences of refugee young people in australia. The video is divided into two sections: Section one explores the refugee experience from the perspective of 5 young who have resettled in Australia from the countries of El Salvador, Vietnam, Afghanistan, Cambodia and Eritrea. It is relevant to both workers and young people. Section two explores issues for service providers and contains interviews with experienced workers with refugee young people. The video can be used in education and training of both young people and professionals working with refugee young people. Includes video training notes.

results.title: The Prince of Central Park
results.creator_credit: Harvey Hart and Lorimar Film Entertainment
results.brief_description: Central Park, New York, inhabited nightly by muggers, rapists and killers, becomes the unlikely venue for two recently orphaned children, Jay Jay and Laurie to find a home. They do however, with Jay Jay proclaiming himself ‘The Prince of Central Park’. Into their world enters a lonely widow (Ruth Gordon), who is eager to share their sense of family and belonging. Based on the novel by Evan Rhodes.

results.title: South America the series. -Volume 1
results.brief_description: Part one of 5 programs on South America introduces us to this mixture of people and shows how they are affecting, and being affected by, their heritage, resources, agriculture, industry and urban vs. rural life. The program pays particular attention to the ethnic mix of the continent and the consequent diversity in cultural and agricultural practices.
